title: Handyman - Full-Time - Residential Condominium Community in Lido Beach, NY
description:
**Job Description**

We are looking for a reliable, dependable handyman with strong customer service skills. In this position you will assist the maintenance team in ensuring our condominium is well maintained, functional, and inviting.

**Handyman Duties and Responsibilities**

· Perform repairs in such areas, but not limited to appliances, carpentry, hardware accessories, masonry, painting, spackling and basic electrical, basic plumbing, and basic HVAC.

· Complete jobs quickly and efficiently, in most cases alone to meet deadlines put forth by management.

· Operate machinery including but not limited to; floor buffers, wet vacuums, dry vacuums.

· Perform simple repairs on amenity space appliances, machines, fitness equipment, and fixtures.

· Complete assigned service requests and repairs from residents consistent with company operating procedures.

· Maintain grounds and curb appeal through snow removal, landscaping and trash management activities.

· Be available for on call activity during off hours and emergencies bases on a pre-determined schedule and need.

· Following health and safety regulations and protocols.

· Performing other tasks as assigned by Management.

· Report any unsafe conditions or situations that require attention to the on-site Management.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**Customer Service Representative**

**The Company**  

Modern Aviation (the Company) is a private equity backed; platform company launched in 2018 that is focused on the fixed-based operator (FBO) sector. The Company has been rapidly growing through the acquisition of FBO locations and has significant additional committed capital from its sponsors to continue to grow the business through future acquisitions. Modern Aviations strategy is to acquire attractive locations and increase EBITDA at these locations through investment and operational and commercial improvements.


Company Benefits


Employee Medical Insurance, Basic Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Vacation and Sick Time, Paid Holidays, HSA Account Funding, 401k Match


Other Available Benefits


Buy-up Medical Insurance, Dental, Vision, Optional Life Insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Account, 401k

**Primary Purpose of the Position**  

Modern Aviation is a Fixed Base Operator (FBO) that services private jets. As a Customer Service Representative, the candidate must represent the Modern Aviation brand by providing Seven Star Service to each person who enters the facility. This individual must take pride in offering the best in service, providing all services with the highest of standards, and always with a smile. The Customer Service Representative manages all customer requests without showing signs of stress or frustration, even under the most demanding of situations.

**Essential Functions**

* Deliver proactive, personalized service to Private and Corporate Aviation clientele.
* Arrange services including hotel, catering, and ground transportation.
* Coordinate aircraft services, such as fuel and hangar storage.
* Input trip data into scheduling software as well as updating customer information in database, as necessary.
* Effectively communicate via air-to-ground radio and ground-to-ground radio, in addition to other forms of communication.
* Educate customers on available services, promotions, and programs.
* Process customer invoices.
* Answer customer questions and resolve issues, as necessary.
* Assists passengers and flight crews with our professional Seven Star Service: always offering additional services and exceeding customer expectations.
* Build and establish customer relationships with local service providers such as hotels, rental car companies, restaurants, etc.
* Maintain lobby appearance and keep snack and beverages stocked.
* Flight tracking via online databases to ensure timely services.
* Perform other duties that may be assigned, as necessary.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Must be 18 years of age.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Intermediate knowledge of all Microsoft Office products.
* Ability to make fast decisions by using judgment consistent with company policies, standard operating procedures, and safety regulations.
* Negotiation and sales skills.
* Reliable multitasking skills.
* Valid drivers license.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Previous customer service experience preferred.
* Basic knowledge of various aircraft types and servicing a plus.

**Reports to**: Customer Service Manager

**Supervisory Responsibility**: This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

**FLSA Status**: This position is nonexempt.

**Work Environment**: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers. This position requires various tasks performed in all types of weather conditions.

**Travel**: This position requires no travel.

**Physical Requirements**: Physically able to perform frequent walking, sitting, stooping, stretching, bending, reaching, and grasping actions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to moving mechanical parts. The employee may be exposed to wet and/or humid conditions including extreme heat and cold. The noise level in the work environment is occasionally loud. May be required to work nights, weekends, and holidays.


**EEO Statement**: The Company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

**Other Duties**: Please note this job description is not designed to cover all activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


If you are interested in applying, please send your cover letter and resume to careers@modern-aviation.com

title: SCHOOL CROSSING GUARD
description:

Assists pedestrians in crossing traffic intersections at an assigned post. Does related work as required.

* Stops traffic at crosswalks to ensure the safety of pedestrians;

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
description:
This is a Full-Time Position, in-person at our East Rutherford, NJ Office.
  
  

**About Brookaire:**  

Brookaire is a leading company specializing in the Manufacturing and Distribution of Air Filters. We are dynamic, fast-paced, and customer oriented. As one of the top resources to find HVAC Air Filters and Belts, we constantly strive to understand our customers needs, and position our products and services to meet those needs. Brookaires employees are committed to a culture of continuous improvement, in view of meeting the high demands of our customers. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a skilled and motivated Sales Development Representative (SDR).
  
  

**Position Description:**  

We're seeking a Sales Development Representative (SDR) in East Rutherford, NJ. This role is dedicated to identifying, qualifying, and scheduling meetings with leads, ultimately contributing to new customer acquisition and sales growth.

Identify and generate unqualified leads within the Utility & Infrastructure sector

Support & guidance from management

Performance-based bonuses

Team-first mindset
  
  

Opportunities for career growth

Base salary starts at $60,000, with performance-based bonuses on leads and converted leadsno cap!

title: Wellness Group Instructor
description:
**Position Summary:**


Under the direction of the Health & Wellness Director, the Group Fitness Instructor is responsible for teaching Group Fitness classes. The Group Fitness Instructors key function is to build strong lasting relationships with members, employees and volunteers that will encourage healthy lifestyles. The Group Fitness Instructor must possess high energy and outstanding teaching, communication, organizational and team-building skills.


**AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:**

* Lead Group Fitness classes, as directed by supervisor, to accomplish the YMCA mission and goals.
* Select all music for classes.
* Help promote YMCA programs as required.
* Conduct energizing, fun, and safe classes.
* Build effective relationships with participants and parents when working with teens.
* Promote a positive environment.
* Keep accurate class attendance records.
* Follow YMCA policies and procedures, including those related to medical and disciplinary situations, child abuse prevention and emergencies.
* Attend or complete all mandatory staff training and meetings as needed.
* Ability to work independently and manage groups of adults or teens.
* Complete incident reports when necessary.
* Maintain class equipment and be accountable for housekeeping in the Exercise Studios.
* Complete Child Abuse Prevention training annually; Required to report any suspected cases of child abuse immediately to supervisor.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* High School Degree Required
* Current certification relevant to the specific Group Fitness classes that the instructor will be teaching.
* CPR, AED, and First Aid certifications (within 45 days of hire).
* Maturity, reliability, organizational skills and preparedness.
* Effective communication and teaching skills.

title: Residential Coordinator
description:
**Join us at Delta Community Supports, Inc. (Delta), where every day brings the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of others! As a leading provider of support services for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities, we're on a mission to empower and enrich the lives of those we serve. Are you passionate about fostering independence, promoting inclusion, and creating meaningful connections? If so, come be a part of our dynamic team where innovation, compassion, and dedication drive our every endeavor. Embark on a rewarding career journey with Delta Community Supports, Inc., and help us shape a brighter future for all!**

**Position Summary**


Delta Community Supports, Inc. is seeking a strategic and results-oriented Residential Coordinator to join our dynamic team. The Residential Coordinator will promote the community support of people with developmental and intellectual disabilities by implementing company policies and providing broad management oversight to daily operations.

**Key Responsibilities:**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The duties listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Ensure the full capacity of programmatic resources.
* Maximize the development and capacity of staff to advance the mission and values of Delta.
* Hire, train, supervise, develop and evaluate direct support staff; assess staff performance and provide support to obtain desired performance outcomes.


Lead monthly meetings with team members to discuss:


o Policy/procedure changes


o Scheduling changes/needs


o Supporting the individuals in the home


o Training needs


o General home needs

* Lead the interdisciplinary process in:


o Assessing the desires, strengths, and needs of the individuals receiving residential supports


o Developing outcomes


o Evaluating progress towards independence in outcomes

* Pursue community integration for each individual.
* Monitor and maintain medical and financial benefits (Social Security Supplemental Security Income, Medical Assistance, etc.).
* Record the use of each individuals personal finances as outlined in Deltas policy.
* Monitor home on a regular basis to include:


o adequate quantity and quality of food to provide nutritious meals


o physical site is in compliance with health, safety and cleanliness standards


o proper economical use of utilities (phone, gas, electric and cable)

* Monitor that fire safety standards are met (fire drills properly completed, smoke detectors are operational).
* Monitor and schedule a sufficient number of trained staff at the home in keeping with state and Delta standards.
* Ensure health care needs of individuals are met.
* Train staff who provide direct service in the implementation of outcomes and the operations of Residential Supports.
* Monitor completion of all staff training within required periods.
* Monitor the administration of medications.
* Meet regularly with individuals workshop, day program or employer.
* Attend meetings, and hearings; visit the homes, schools, workplaces and recreational sites of individuals supported by the company.
* Cooperate with the Department of Human Services staff in any investigation or inspection.
* Cooperate with internal investigations or inspections.
* Complete all paperwork accurately including, but not limited to, Critical Logs, ISP data, etc.
* Comply with all of Deltas policies as well as regulatory and licensing standards.
* Develop; implement and role model program plans areas such as positive behavioral supports, community living, communications, etc.
* Coordinate individuals medical appointments, advocate for the individual, complete paperwork regarding each appointment communicate medical status to management and families.


Ensure the proper and timely completion and maintenance of records.

* Promote and demonstrate ethical and professional conduct at all times ensuring employees conduct themselves in an ethical and professional manner.
* Promote continuous quality improvement projects and ongoing performance measures.
* Monitor the development and implementation of high quality individual support plans.
* Promote and address Deltas Risk Management Program for the health and safety of individuals and employees.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* A bachelors degree from an accredited college or university
* Two (2) years work experience working directly with persons with intellectual disabilities
* An associates degree or sixty (60) credit hours from an accredited university or college and four (4) years experience in the supervision of community based programs working directly with persons with intellectual disabilities may be substituted.

**Benefits:**

* Variety of available work schedules to accommodate different lifestyles and preferences.
* Qualified Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) employer, offering assistance with student loan forgiveness programs.
* 401k Match program, with a generous match of 3%.
* Comprehensive healthcare coverage, including medical, dental, and vision insurance plans.
* Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for healthcare and dependent care expenses.
* Commuter benefits to help with transportation costs.
* Hospital insurance coverage for unexpected medical expenses.
* Critical Illness Insurance to provide financial support during serious illnesses.
* Identity Theft protection for peace of mind.
* Legal Assistance for personal and professional matters.
* Company Paid Life Insurance coverage for employees and supplemental Life Insurance for additional coverage.
* Company Paid Short-Term Disability Insurance for Pennsylvania employees, providing financial protection in the event of a short-term disability.
* Long-term Disability (LTD) Insurance coverage to support employees in case of long-term disabilities.
* Company Paid Holidays to celebrate important occasions.
* Up to 2 weeks of vacation time in Year One, providing time for relaxation and rejuvenation.
* Up to 2 Floating Holidays for additional flexibility in scheduling time off.
* Up to 15 days of Sick Time to ensure employees can take care of their health without worrying about lost income.
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP), providing eligible employees with confidential counseling, support services, and resources to enhance well-being and maintain work-life balance.
* Professional development and internal advancement opportunities.
* Please note that participation in the listed benefits is contingent upon eligibility criteria.

**Delta Community Supports is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to diversity and equal opportunity in our recruitment and hiring. Qualified candidates of all backgrounds are welcome and encouraged to apply for this position.**

**EOE M/F/D/V**

title: Wait Staff/Server
description:
We are looking for a competent Wait Staff/Server to take and deliver orders. You’ll be the face of our restaurant and responsible for our customers’ experiences. Food server responsibilities include ensuring our tables are clean and tidy when guests arrive, presenting menus and serving food and beverages. You need to be quick on your feet (literally and metaphorically) and have a polite and friendly attitude. If you enjoy talking to people and thrive in a fast-paced workplace, we’d like to meet you. Your ultimate goal will be to provide high-quality service that will help us maintain and attract customers.

**Responsibilities**

* Prepare restaurant tables with special attention to sanitation and order
* Attend to customers upon entrance
* Present restaurant menus and help customers select food/beverages
* Take and serve orders
* Answer questions or make recommendations for complementary products
* Collaborate with other restaurant servers and kitchen/bar staff
* Deal with complaints or problems with a positive attitude

* Hands-on experience in cashier duties
* Attention to cleanliness and safety
* Patience and customer-oriented approach
* Excellent people skills with a friendly attitude
* Responsible and trustworthy

title: Infant Assistant Teacher
description:
**Job Opening:**



The Malvern School is currently seeking an Assistant Teacher for the Infant classroom at The Malvern School of Washington Township, NJ. This is a full-time position, Monday - Friday.


**What You Will Receive:**



We offer teachers exciting benefits!


* 60% childcare discount to ALL employees so that your family can take advantage of our great learning environment!
* Greater latitude in designing creative curriculum
* State-of-art classrooms in professionally cleaned, attractive facilities
* Company-paid training for CPR, First Aid, and more!
* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits
* 401K
* Holiday pay, including a week-long paid Winter Holiday break
* Paid time off
* Unlimited referral bonuses
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Bonus incentives


**Job Summary:**



We are seeking a highly motivated, career-oriented teacher with a passion for Early Childhood Education whose general duties will be as follows.


* Teacher assists in the implementation of a superior Early Childhood Education program in accordance with school policies and Malvern School philosophy.
* Teacher maintains a safe, healthy and educational environment for the class.
* Teacher communicates regularly with parents, in person and through the use of technology, meeting (or exceeding) parent expectations.


**What we need from you:**


* High school diploma and be at least 18 years of age
* At least 2500 hours (1 year, 4 months) months of documented experience with young children in a licensed facility OR 15 relevant college credits (or CDA) and at least 1250 hours (8 months) documented experience with young children in a licensed facility
* Must be (or be willing to start) pursuing a CDA (Child Development Associate) OR a degree in the field


**A Little More About Us:**



The Malvern School is dedicated to educating young children through innovative programming. We are proud of our focus on a quality, child-centered philosophy and clean, attractive facilities. We encourage a strong sense of teamwork and a professional atmosphere. In addition to our generous compensation package, we offer ongoing professional development and opportunities for career advancement at our growing company.



The Malvern School curriculum is designed to meet or exceed the standards established by the National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC), the nation’s largest early childhood accrediting organization. Daycares or preschools that meet NAEYC’s standards of excellence provide an environment with a focus on health and safety, have teachers who are well trained, have access to excellent teaching materials, and work with curriculum that is appropriately challenging and developmentally sound to provide high-quality education for children in Pennsylvania and New Jersey. The Malvern School might be the perfect place for you!



Visit our website to see how your commute would be and to learn more about our school: https://malvernschool.com/our-schools/find-a-preschool-near-me/
company_description: At The Malvern School your child will learn and feel loved. With locations in PA and NJ, we provide the best in early childhood education.

title: Warehouse Operations Manager - North Arlington, NJ
description:
**Mission of the Role (What you will be doing)**


The Operations Manager will plan, direct and coordinate the locations business activities and develop, lead, and implement effective strategies and processes to achieve efficiencies and operational excellence. The Operations Manager will set and foster a clear mission and deploy best practice strategies to ensure that office and plant operations work together effectively providing an outstanding customer experience, ensure sustainability, and meet business objectives.

**Key Duties & Accountabilities (Primary responsibilities & quantifiable measurements)**

* Support the achievement of revenue, GP and EBITDA targets
* Oversee daily business operations and evaluate performance and productivity on a regular and ongoing basis
* Manage receiving of inventory into the warehouse
* Manage the tracking of drivers on routes and proactively adjust routes to meet customer needs
* Review short item list from night before to be picked, shipped, and rescheduled on second run trucks
* Coordinate price quotes and scheduling of pickups with 3PL.
* Work with daytime warehouse employees for efficiency in putting inventory away to keep warehouse clean and orderly.
* Work with customer service for NE region locations for customer deliveries, etc.
* Coordinate with truck PMs, repairs, replacement
* Establish and implement departmental policies, goals, objectives and procedures, conferring with executive leadership and staff as appropriate
* Identify, develop, and lead successful, thorough implementation of plans to execute on growth opportunities and initiatives
* Create and collaborate to identify and implement practices to improve upon potential gaps for goal achievement
* Maintain an active presence with the appropriate customers and suppliers
* Identify staffing needs, and lead effective hiring and practices to ensure a team of aces
* Coach, champion employee development, and engagement, and delegate responsibilities appropriately to optimize management and team capabilities
* Spearhead strategies to steer the locations future in a positive direction
* Drive operating capabilities to maximize customer retention, and company goals
* Control location costs, and introduce tactical initiatives to drive efficiencies
* Assess and implement improved processes and new technologies, and collaborate with management and team regarding the implementation of these improvements
* Maintain the integrity and accuracy of product in the warehouse

**Educational/Training Requirements/Experience (What your background should look like)**

* Degree in Business Management, Business Administration or proven working experience of a minimum of 5 years leading and managing teams
* Excellent knowledge of management methods and techniques
* Experience working in the Packaging industry or similar industry preferred
* Experience working in a Union environment

**Minimum Skills, Knowledge & Ability Requirements**

* Ability to think strategically and to lead others
* Strong leadership qualities
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
* Advanced trouble-shooting, problem-solving and multi-tasking skills
* Highly organized
* Ability to drive a forklfift
* Meticulous attention to detail
* Computer literate, proficiency in Microsoft Office
* Proactive nature
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office

title: Front Desk Concierge
description:
Job Description: Title:  
**Title: CONCIERGE**  
**Hours: M-F 8-5pm**  
**Location: New York, NY 10281**  
**Assignment Duration: 3 Months(potential for extension)**

Resource's typical working day:  
This large financial client has their workforce returning part time to the office. With a large population returning it can be difficult to ensure everyone has a desk to sit at and feels truly supported and welcomed back.

title: Market Table Attendant
description:
At Fogo de Chão, we strive to give our guests an unforgettable dining experience of discovery while showcasing the Culinary Art of Churrasco. Our mission is to ignite fire and joy to care for our team, our guests, and our communities.We believe better futures start when we bring our best to the table every day to Feed a Purposeful Future – starting with our team members. We feed our teams with fulfilling job opportunities, making space around the table so everyone feels welcome. At Fogo, we’ll provide you with a fulfilling career with professional and personal growth opportunities at every level. Our values of teamwork, integrity, excellence, humility and *Deixa Comigo* (we’ve got you!) are more than just words, it’s how we do things every day.  

  

Now Hiring / Immediately Hiring:  

Market Table (Salad Bar) Attendant / Kitchen Prep  

  

In this role you will:* Provides support through preparation and proper presentation of all salad bar items, side dishes and desserts according to recipe in an efficient manner.
* Ensures that the quality of all inventory and fresh produce are of the highest standards including proper management of inventory levels including the storage area.
* Assists management with tracking of expiration dates on all products.
* Maintains cleanliness of all kitchen equipment and areas.
* Complete any beginning or closing shift duties.


Requirements:* Must be able to transport objects up to 50 lbs, stand for long periods of time, and work at a quick pace.
* Must be able to work weekends and holidays.

*Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance are available for full-time, hourly Team Members on the first of the month following 60 days of employment. Additionally, company-paid Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability are provided where allowed. We offer a comprehensive voluntary benefits package including Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Accident Coverage, Permanent Life, and Pet Insurance.**Part-Time Team Members are offered a Minimum Essential Coverage (MEC) Health plan in addition to Dental, Vision, Short-Term Disability, and Life Insurance. Coverage for these plans can start as early as the first of the month following your hire date. Additionally, Part-Time Team Members are offered enrollment in voluntary benefits, including Pet Insurance, Legal, and ID Protection.*  

  

Fogo de Chão is an Equal Opportunity & E Verify Employer
This position has a pay range that starts at 16.00 and goes up to 19.00. Your rate is dependent upon your relevant work experience.

title: PROGRAM SUPERVISOR
description:
UCP Long Island is a not for profit agency whose mission is to advance the independence, productivity and full citizenship of persons with cerebral palsy and other disabilities. We are proud of our more than 60 year history in creating opportunities and helping to fulfill the dreams of thousands of individuals and families. We remain committed to our goal of Creating Life Without Limits for People With Disabilities!
  
  

This position will oversee various residences throughout Suffolk County
  
General Purpose of the Job Responsible for overall administration of assigned residences, including regulation compliance, staff supervision & training, monitoring of budgets and physical plant issues, and ensure quality of care for the individuals served.
  
  

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
  
Insure adequate coverage of all residences, i.e., monthly staffing/scheduling. Insure proper correspondence with parents and outside providers, i.e., day programs, DDSO, caseworkers.
  
Supervise financial component.
  
Inspect the DDP's for accurate completion and documentation.
  
Relay state and agency policy to staff.
  
Insure quality care service.
  
Audit preparation of consumer records to meet state and federal regulations.
  
Coordinate, attend, and insure accurate completion of incident review component.
  
Weekly supervision of managers/assistant managers.
  
Maintain weekly residence managers/assistant managers staff meetings.
  
Conduct staff evaluations - residence managers, assistant managers, and clinical team.
  
Interview and hire residence mangers, assistant managers, and clinical team.
  
Rotating on call administrator.
  
Manage subordinate supervisors who supervise employees in the Residential Program-Managers, Social Workers; Applied Behavior Specialists, Nurses and Recreation Therapists.
  
Responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of these units. Also directly supervises varies non-supervisory employees. Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
  
  

Education and/or Experience
  
Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university and one to three years related experience and/or training. OPWDD experience.
  
UCP of Long Island is an equal opportunity employer.
  
**Job Type:** Full-time
company_description: For over 70 years, United Cerebral Palsy of Long Island has positively impacted the lives of people with disabilities through the outstanding quality of our programs and services!

title: Sales Account Manager, Food & Nutrition
description:
LBB Specialties LLC (LBB Specialties or the Company) is ranked in the top 4 of dedicated North American specialty chemical and ingredients distributors. The LBB Specialties (LBBS) platform has been built through seven acquisitions since 2017. The Company is a diversified, national supplier serving end-markets including personal care, food & nutrition, life sciences and advanced materials. LBB Specialties generates over $500 million of annual revenue.


LBB Specialties is a subsidiary of LBB Industries LLC (LBB Industries). LBB Industries is a private firm whose objective is to create value by partnering with management teams to build and grow companies over the long term. LBB Industries capital and resources are dedicated to supporting the growth of its companies, including by seeking complementary acquisitions.


**Overview**


The Sales Account Manager will be responsible for cultivating productive and mutually beneficial relationships with customers across the food and nutrition market.

**Responsibilities**  

1. Develop long-term, productive relationships with current customers by understanding their business needs and seeking to address their challenges.  

2. Ensure that the customer views LBBS as trusted partner and problem-solver.  

3. Leverage market knowledge to seek opportunities for new business development. Identify, prioritize, nurture and develop potential sales.  

4. Establish (and follow) a rigorous process for following up on new leads, pursuing new lines of inquiry, etc.  

5. Understand market trends and competitive environment in our market segments.  

6. Provide market and customer feedback to all internal stakeholders.  

7. Maintain and grow an active Opportunity Pipeline.  

8. Be an active member of the Food & Nutrition Vertical by leading the efforts on top suppliers and sub-vertical products that are key for our long-term growth.

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelors degree required.
* Minimum five years sales experience in the food & nutrition market with customer facing roles.
* Proven sales track record with customers in the food & nutrition market.

**Knowledge and Skills**

* General knowledge of consumer and marketplace trends.
* Generate leads with hunter mentality.
* Familiarity with key customer contacts and/or relationships with suppliers is desired.
* Excellent computer skills including (Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

**Personal Attributes**

* Personal integrity. The highest standard of personal and professional conduct.
* Entrepreneurial mindset coupled with discipline.
* Strong work ethic and personal initiative.
* The ability to work independently with little day-to-day supervision.
* Consultative, solutions-oriented sales approach.
* Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to present information in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
* Self-starter who works with minimal supervision and is comfortable working in a dynamic, changing environment.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with others.
* Must be able to travel 50% (mostly by vehicle).

**Additional Information**

* Remote position
* Base salary, car allowance, uncapped commission potential
* Travel: Approx. 50% (customer meetings, industry events, etc.)

**EEO Statement**


LBB Specialties is committed to providing a fair and equal employment opportunity for all employees and job applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, marital status, disability, medical history or genetic information, military service, or other non-merit based factors.


We believe that employees should be provided with a working environment that fosters productivity and the ability to work to the best of his/her ability. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, marital status, disability, medical history or genetic information, military service, or other non-merit based factors.


We expect and require the cooperation of all employees in maintaining a discrimination and harassment-free atmosphere.

**Disclaimer**


This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of the activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required and these may change from time to time.

title: Race Coach Sailing
description:
**Mission**


Our mission at the Larchmont Yacht Club is to instill and enhance an interest in yachting and sportsmanship in the Corinthian spirit and uphold our reputation as a prestigious center of yachting and yacht racing. Our Club's yacht racing, leisure, intra and inter club competitions, and sporting events provide an engaging and enjoyable social experience for our members and their families in which they can participate with pride and enthusiasm.

**Job Summary:**


The Larchmont Yacht Club seeks an experienced and proactive Race Coach to lead our high school sailing teams and oversee a race group during our summer junior program. The Race Coach will work with the Larchmont Yacht Club Waterfront Department to provide programming to empower our members to perform at any level of sailing. Reporting directly to the Sailing Director, the successful candidate will organize and execute practice sessions, guide on-water coaching, and assist with winter Frostbiting sessions. The role demands excellent organizational skills, effective communication abilities, and a deep understanding of sailing dynamics and program management to further enhance the club's mission of promoting yachting and sportsmanship.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities**

* Lead the LYC High School sailing teams including practice planning and on-water coaching
* Lead coach of a summer Race Team C420 or Opti
* Assist with Frostbiting on-water
* Create additional sailing programming and clinics in the shoulder seasons

**Job Tasks/Duties:**

* Take ownership of routine fleet maintenance including proper storage
* Develop and coach additional programming for LYC adult and junior members
* Promote a culture that reflects the mission of Larchmont Yacht Club
* Quick response times to both email and phone inquiries during working hours
* Schedule sailing as required, e.g. concierge sailing program, private lessons
* Be an on-water lead and example for seasonal coaches
* Coordinate boat repairs with Marine Facilities

**Education and/or Experience:**

* Prior coaching experience, preferably high school or collegiate.
* Competitive collegiate and/or international sailing experience, preferred.
* Substantial dinghy racing experience, preferred.
* Bachelor's Degree, required.

**Licenses and Special Requirements**

* US Sailing Level 1 or higher certification
* Basic First Aid and CPR (training available)
* Ability to expertly operate a powerboat
* Safe Sport Certified

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**

* Must be able to comply with the Club's policies and procedures
* Must be able to lift 50lbs or more
* Work evenings and weekend days as assigned
* Work outdoors in all weather conditions
* Working on weekends is required as assigned
* Demonstrated ability to work with and relate well to students

**Compensation:**

* $65,000.00/annual salary
* 401(k)
* PTO
* Health benefits
* Housing consideration

title: Service Receptionist
description:
Are you searching for long-term growth and development in your career? Then Paul Miller Auto Group is ready for you to join our award-winning team! Paul Miller doesnt just lend his name to a dealership; he ensures it maintains a reputation as the gold-standard for the loyalty and respect given to his valuable employees. If youre ready to thrive in an environment where your professional and personal goals are supported, submit your application and join Paul Miller Audi Team today!

* Company Funded Life Insurance
* Health & Wellness Reimbursement Program
* 401K & Roth Investment Options
* FSA for both Health and Dependent
* Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Holiday!)

**Responsibilities**

* Transfer the appropriate information from each repair order hard copy to the soft copies (reconcile the repair orders).
* Total the retail parts, fluids, and labor charges, to calculate a total for each category.
* Collect the total retail charges from the customer in cash, check, or authorized charge account.
* Provide the customer with the proper change and/or receipts.
* Properly document charge purchases according to the policies established by the business manager.
* Complete the accounting section of the repair order as directed by the business manager.
* Accumulate and deliver to the business office daily all repair orders and parts invoices closed during the business day.
* Handle and account for daily the cash in and out in the assigned money box.
* Control the keys associated with completed repair orders, return customer's keys to them when their bills are paid and direct customers to where they may find their vehicle.
* File repair orders as directed by service department management.
* Answer the service department telephone, transfer calls to the people requested or best suited to take the calls, and take written messages when the needed personnel are not available.
* Be courteous and helpful to all customers and obtain immediate assistance for situations needing service management.
* Maintain a level of personal appearance consistent with the standards set by the dealership.

* Experience with Microsoft Office suite is a plus
* Ability to communicate customers' interests needs and requests to management and sales personnel
* Professional personal appearance
* Clean driving record
* Must be willing to submit to a drug screen & background check.

I also understand that this job description does not constitute a contract of employment nor alter my status as an at-will employee. title: Human Resource Onboarding Specialist
description:
**Overview: Human Resources Onboarding Specialist**
The HR Onboarding Specialist will work closely with the Director of Human Resources for a mid-to-large sized nonprofit organization to help manage employee recruitment, hiring process by reviewing and processing new hire paperwork, and record maintenance. Their role is to serve as a first line of contact between employees and the HR department. They prepare new employee intake paperwork and assist employees with access to the training and benefits they need. The HR Onboarding Specialist sorts, and updates records, disposes of old records properly, and makes day-to-day updates to the online employee management system and employee records as needed.**Primary Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:*** Assist with the recruiting and hiring process, review, and process new hire paperwork
* Obtain and verify employment references
* Handle background checks and clearances with outside vendors
* Schedules new hire orientations and assists with onboarding new hires with onboarding procedures
* Accurately manages employee files both hard and virtual copies
* Ability to maintain high level of confidentiality
* Assist with day-to-day operations of HR functions and duties

**Essential skills and qualifications for an ideal HR Onboarding Specialist**:* Knowledge of online Paycom system
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office programs
* Knowledge of the Department of Health compliance procedures and fingerprints
* Familiar with fingerprints procedures related to the Department of Education
* Knowledge of administrative tasks and responsibilities
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Problem-solving skills and resourceful thinking
* Leadership and coaching skills
* Strong empathy and interpersonal skills
* Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills
* Attention to detail and analytically driven

**Required Education and Experience*** High School Diploma
* 2 years of experience with administration and data entry

**Preferred Education and Experience*** 2+ years of experience in Human Resources or related field
* Basic knowledge of Paycom

title: Buying Operations Associate
description:
We are a high volume ecommerce company that sells a wide array of products across many online platforms. We specialize in photography, electronics, audio, and houseware products. Our company has been in business for over 50 years and employs over 150 people across three locations (Brooklyn HQ, NJ warehouse, NJ satellite office). Our employees are passionate, smart, hardworking, and considerate - and together they accomplish great things.

We are looking for a Buying Operations Associate to support the Director of Buying and to serve as a liaison inter-departmentally. This position is located within our Buying Department in our Brooklyn, NY corporate office.

In this role, you will work closely with the Director of Buying to lead initiatives, research, monitor POs, interact with departments, attend meetings, and general project management. The ideal candidate must possess a strong business acumen, be detail-oriented, have industry-specific work experience, have good communication skills, be comfortable working in a team, and keep buyers updated. You must also be a self starter who is able to identify gaps in the business process to escalate where appropriate.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Provide direct support to the Director of Buying and to the buying team as needed
* Lead the PO process and alert the Director of Buying to all discrepancies
* Complete administrative tasks as assigned by the Director of Buying
* Adept at communicating and negotiating with suppliers on the Director of Buying behalf when needed
* Maintain an organized workflow using end-to-end completion of all tasks
* Submit weekly project and progress reports
* Act as a liaison with our IT, Content, Platform, and Warehouse departments to follow up on all open ticket requests received from the buying team
* Assist with planning, monitoring, and maintaining suitable inventory levels
* Perform routine data analytics, forecasting, and reporting using Excel

**Requirements:**

* General understanding of e-commerce marketplaces i.e. Amazon, eBay, and Walmart
* Must possess a basic understanding of the buying process (velocity, P&L, etc.)
* Understanding of retail math (open to buy, aged inventory, etc.)
* Comfortable using systems and platforms (Sellercloud, ticketing systems, Power BI, MS Office, etc.)
* Ability to analyze trends, perform under pressure, be adaptive, and able to quickly switch gears
* Must have previous experience supporting C-level executives in an administrative or operational capacity

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11218 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Country Club Bartender
description:
This is not your everyday, run-of-the-mill hospitality job posting. We CARE about you, the potential employee. Your happiness, work/life balance, job/wage security and growth as a professional is paramount and very important to our management team!

Flexibility with scheduling allows you (the employee) a work/life balance.

Here’s the story: We are an affluent, historical Golf Country Club seeking Full Time or Part Time Bartenders for our Food and Beverage Department. Within that department resides our a la carte restaurant program and our banquet/event program. Our Country Club provides one of the ***BEST*** Food & Beverage programs in the country.

The Club is looking for driven, positive, outgoing, energetic people to offer top-tier, top-shelf service to our esteemed membership. The pay range will vary, depending on experience within the industry and knowledge of all things beverage and skillsket.

Please see below.

* Are you an exemplary hospitality bartender with years of experience? Super. **We want YOU.** Your starting pay will be $25 an hour. **This $25 wage IS NEGOTIABLE for those with more than seven years of experience in BOTH a la carte and banquet operations. We will fact check and call professional references. Have them ready.**

**BASED ON PERFORMANCE**

**PERKS OF THE JOB IF YOU WORK WITH US:** 

* Working with a forward-thinking management team that understands the work/life balance and where the industry is heading. Bottom line, we take care of our employees.
* Interactive Training Sessions with Wine Tasting (Yum!), Food Tasting, (Yum, Yum!!) and learning and growing with some of the top Food & Beverage Managers in the game.
* Usage of our Gym facility after-hours (10pm to 3am).
* Usage of our Golf Course on Mondays!
* Club sponsored team building activities for the staff throughout the season.
* Annual Holiday Party at the end of the year.
* Staff Meals! Large buffet-type spreads for our entire team for both Lunch and Dinner.
* Prizes for high test scores and leading in sales revenue.

Below is a general idea of the responsibilities required for the job along with some of the qualifications that we are seeking.

* Experience in a la carte restaurant bartending and/or experience in banquet/event bartending! Either is acceptable but if you have experience with BOTH, well, you might have an upper hand in negotiations!
* Delivering five-star service to the members and executing drinks the proper way for member satisfaction.
* While the job requires you to work primarily on the weekends, there is work to be had during the week, as well. Note that *most* of the big Holidays are mandatory working days. While you may work *most* holidays, we will make it up to you elsewhere. The Club is closed Christmas Day and New Years Day.
* Outgoing, positive, reliable mindset.
* Comfortable with people and carrying on a conversation.
* Ability to look people in the eye.
* Ability to follow direction.
* Can set up and breakdown a bar with minimal supervision.
* It is imperative that you arrive to work on time, in a full clean pressed uniform. (The Club will provide you with most of the uniform.)
* Familiarity and knowledge with all types of wine, cocktails, beer and beverages.
* You should be a GREAT listener and comfortable with taking and understanding food and drink orders. Receiving the food and drink orders from the members and inputting those orders properly into the Point-of-Sale system (POS) is one of the most important parts of the job.
* Someone who remains calm and levelheaded no matter the circumstance.
* Should be willing and able to work days, nights, weekends, and Holidays. Again, we will work with you and be flexible here!
* Able to handle 10 to 25 members/guests at any time during the lunch or dinner meal periods.
* Able to lift and carry up to 25-50 pounds.
* Ability to stand for long periods of time and go up and down stairs during your shift.
* Ability to work outside in summer-time weather conditions.
* You do not run away from challenges or when times get tough.
* Can effectively work with your co-workers and assist them if need be.
* Knowledge of Golf, Tennis, Pickleball, Squash or all of these activities is important but not imperative.
* It is important to work well with others and be an exemplary teammate.

If you believe you have what it takes, email me directly at mdimaggio@apawamis.org or call 914-967-2100 to setup an interview.

title: Full Time Nanny needed in Larchmont
description:
**Full Time Nanny needed in Larchmont**

A loving family of 4 is looking for a full time nanny for their 4 and 2 year old! This is a great role for someone with strong knowledge of age-appropriate activities, someone who puts the safety of the children above all and truly loves working with children. Responsibilities include sensory play, creating fun and age appropriate activities, monitoring the child’s growth and development, light meal prep, and child’s laundry. The position starts ASAP. They are looking for someone who is warm, efficient, and can work with them as a team and become a part of their family.

**Ideal Nanny**

The ideal nanny candidate would embody a blend of professionalism, warmth, and reliability. They would have a sincere passion for childcare, consistently demonstrating patience, creativity, and enthusiasm in their interactions with children. With a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, they would be well-versed in developmental milestones, capable of planning and facilitating activities that promote learning and growth.

Possessing a valid First Aid/CPR certification, the candidate would prioritize safety and be prepared to handle emergencies efficiently. Their references would reflect a history of dependable, compassionate care, and their background check would be clear of any discrepancies. They would be a non-smoker with reliable transportation and a clean driving record, indicative of their dependability. Flexibility is crucial, and the ideal candidate would adapt seamlessly to our changing schedules, showing availability for occasional weekends and a long-term commitment to our family.

**Position Requirements**

Experience: Minimum of 5 years of professional childcare experience.

Certification: Valid First Aid/CPR certification for infants and children.

References: Excellent references from previous employers.

Background Check: Clear background check.

Communication: Strong communication skills in English.

Driver’s License: Valid driver's license and clean driving record (for driving positions).

Age Group Experience: Experience with newborns].

Activity Planning: Ability to plan and engage in developmentally appropriate activities.

Housekeeping: Willingness to perform light housekeeping related to the children.

Transportation: Reliable transportation.

Flexibility: Flexibility with hours and availability for occasional weekends.

Commitment: Ability to commit long term.

**Compensation/Benefits**

Competitive Pay: $30-$35 per hour (paid fully on the books)

Benefits: PTO, Sick Days, Federal Holidays +

If you meet the qualifications and are excited about this opportunity, please log in and review your candidate profile. Make sure your profile is complete and up to date with your current position.

---

***Modern Maison is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply.***

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $30.00 - $35.00 per hour

Schedule:

title: Case Aide
description:
**About HeartShare**

For over 100 years, HeartShare has dedicated itself to improving the lives of people needing special services and support. The HeartShare team, now 2,100 employees and growing, helps individuals develop to their potential and lead meaningful lives

**Job Summary**


The Family Case Aide provides support to the Case Planner and Supervisors with case management and administrative tasks. The Family Case Aide will smooth the level of paperwork, advocacy, and communication to and from clients and team members to increase the program's productivity.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Gathering client resources (e.g., mental health services, vocational/alternative school settings, housing information, recreational activities, etc.
* Assist with reception coverage as needed such as answering the telephone, screen, and direct calls.
* Escort individuals and families to appointments when needed and maintain accurate and up-to-date progress notes for each contact.
* Ensure client confidentiality and audit compliance.
* Escort individuals and families to appointments when needed.
* Request school and medical records from the service provider.
* Self-motivational skills and the ability to work collaboratively with a team.
* Establish and maintain respectful professional boundaries with individuals and families.
* The ability to assist in the engagement of families through casework.
* Knowledge, understanding, and respect for diverse cultural norms and traditions with clients and co-workers.

**Qualifications**

* HS Diploma or equivalent ; Associates Degree Required
* Bilingual Spanish/English preferred
* Strong advocacy, communication, and organizational skills.
* Two Years of Child Welfare experience or related Human Services are preferred, but we are willing to train.

**Benefits**  

What we offer once YOU join our growing family:


At HeartShare we offer a comprehensive benefit package based on full-time/part-time status. You can expect:

* Paid time off (holidays, vacation in accordance with school calendar, sick and personal)
* Professional development opportunities
* Team environment
* Medical and dental benefits
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Optional insurance (life, disability, etc.)
* 403(B) retirement plans
* Flexible spending account (dependent care, medical, parking, and transit)
* Employee assistance program


HeartShare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). If you need to request accommodation during the recruiting process, please reach out to Leaves@heartshare.org.

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
**Job Summary**


What is a Direct Support Professional?


The Direct Support Professional (DSP) is responsible for implementing person-centered services for each individual. This includes ensuring implementation of the individuals services, goals, and outcomes in relation to program-based and community inclusion activities. In addition, the Direct Support Professional is solely responsible for the individual's overall physical and emotional well-being.

**Job Responsibilities**


You would be responsible for:

* Under supervision, provide support and services which involve advocating for, encouraging, guiding, and teaching individuals in expressing personal choice, ensuring community integration, assisting individuals with personal hygiene care, toileting, lifts and transfers, dining, dressing, and meal preparation.
* You would help individuals to participate in games and recreational programs; coach and encourage individuals to develop daily living skills; and provide a clean, safe, and comfortable environment.
* You would collaborate with other staff to implement and record care plans and, in accordance with special instructions, you may administer medication. *These positions are physically demanding*.
* You would need to be prepared to act to ensure the health and safety of individuals in emergency situations.
* You will participate in staff meetings, in-service training and on-site workshops as required for professional growth and development. Attending external training and workshops in the direction of direct supervisor or program management. Maintain certification in \\*AMAP, CPR, First Aid and SCIP, as required. ***\\*Note: Failure to maintain AMAP certification can result in removal of full-time employee status.***
* You must be able to stand for extended periods of time, bend, stretch, and lift bedridden and/or incapacitated individuals.
* You will help to promote and support the inclusion of individuals in their community according to their unique needs, interests, and desires. Model and encourage interaction between individuals and community members. Help foster individuals personal growth by assisting in forming and maintaining friendships with neighbors, co-workers, and peers.
* You will help with transporting individuals or assist them in taking public transportation.
* You will assist in maintaining positive communications with family members, advocates, and service providers as per program needs.


To learn more about what direct support professionals do on the job every day, go tohttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cnK4z3KAqtE.


You are a good fit if you have:

* High school diploma, GED, CNA (Certified Nursing Assistant certification) or possess a Direct Support Professional (DSP) certificate from an accredited public or private organization.
* One year or more work experience with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred.
* Excellent written, communication and mathematical skills.
* Valid NYS driver license preferred but not required.
* A flexible work schedule.

**Benefits**


What we offer once YOU join our growing family:


At HeartShare we offer a comprehensive benefit package based on full-time/part-time status. You can expect:

* Paid time off (holidays, vacation in accordance with school calendar, sick and personal)
* Professional development opportunities
* Team environment
* Medical and dental benefits
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Optional insurance (life, disability, etc.)
* 403(B) retirement plans
* Flexible spending account (dependent care, medical, parking, and transit)
* Employee assistance program


HeartShare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). If you need to request accommodation during the recruiting process, please reach out to Leaves@heartshare.org.

**About HeartShare**


Who WE ARE:


For over one hundred years, HeartShare has dedicated itself to improving the lives of people needing special services and support. The HeartShare team, now 2,100 employees and growing, helps individuals develop to their fullest potential and lead meaningful and enriched lives.


To learn more about HeartShare, please visit our website at www.heartshare.org or Follow us onTwitterLinkedInYouTubeInstagramFacebook

title: Managed Care Liaison - Remote
description:
Summary of Job

Provide confidential administrative support/assistance to the department; support the department in all aspects of daily ops. Ensure high-touch coordination with Office of Children and Family Services (OCFS), Local Departments of Social Services (LDSS,) and (if applicable) the Voluntary Foster Care Agency (VFCA), the member is enrolled in, for all members in foster care, including oversight and coordination of the Foster Care requirements.  

* Act as Subject Matter Expert with the necessary experience, expertise and knowledge of the member’s welfare system, foster care healthcare requirements and the unique complex needs (including resultant of trauma) of the Foster Care population. Serve as the direct Plan contact for coordinators and service providers, responsible for monitoring access for members in foster care.


Responsibilities
* Communicate relevant notification from LDSS coordinator when a member in foster care is enrolled in the managed care plan or when a current managed care member is entering foster care.
* Support the counties in addressing issues for managed care members in foster care.
* from foster care or disenrollment from an MCO.
* Collaborate with LDSS coordinator to ensure assessments are completed on time.
* Assist with care coordination if member is considered unstable by HCP or LDSS; or has a chronic condition.
* Report to the LDSS foster care coordinator any change in member’s status (i.e., address, health status, etc.).
* Assist with discharge
* Collaborate with LDSS coordinator to ensure continuity of care plans are in place upon disenrollment or discharge from foster care.
* Collaborate with LDSS coordinator to ensure that the LDSS and MCO (if plan transfer) are aware of the transition and current care plan can be coordinated.
* Participate in the development of project plans; tracking and management of projects; and departmental activities related to foster care schedule and cost.
* Perform other duties as directed, requested, assigned, or required


Qualifications
* Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Nursing
* Current unrestricted New York State RN license
* CCM certification required, or successful completion of certification within 180 days of hire date as a condition of continued employment
* 4 – 6+ years of relevant work experience, preferably with a healthcare provider (Required)
* 3 – 4+ years of clinical experience, including Medicaid experience (Required)
* Health plan experience, preferably in a clinical setting (Preferred)
* Experience with Population Health Management (Required)
* Experience with managing people/processes in care management settings (Required)
* Strong organizing, prioritizing, and problem identification and solving skills (Required)
* Analytical skills; attention to detail (Required)
* Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal) with all types/levels of audiences. (R)
* Proficient in MS Office - Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, etc. (Required)
* Proven track record of successfully completing projects/tasks in alignment with overall strategies (Required)

description:

title: Case Manager
description:
**Summary:**


The OASAS Housing Program provides individuals and families who have a history of substance use with supportive case management services enabling them to work towards a less supported housing environment.


The Case Manager will be responsible for case managing clients in our OASAS funded Housing Programs.

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist clients in working towards securing more independent housing.
* Assist clients in the design and implementation of individual service plans that reflect mutually agreed upon short and long-term goals.
* Assist clients in learning or refining the skills necessary to maintain their own housing which may including budgeting and money management, apartment upkeep and maintenance, employment, etc.
* Assist clients in obtaining and maintaining all government benefits/entitlements and services when necessary.
* Make appropriate referrals, such as medical care, mental health services, vocational services, recreational activities and substance abuse.
* Conduct at least once a month home visits.
* Accompany clients to appointments (medical, mental health, housing interviews, etc).
* Coordinate care with outside providers (addiction treatment, mental health, child welfare, benefits, etc).
* Maintain an accurate, confidential and current chart on all clients on caseload.
* Attend regularly scheduled supervision meetings with Program Director.
* Participate in Team Meetings and other Division meetings as scheduled.


The position is a hybrid role, with one day of remote work from home, and is subject to potential changes at any given time.

* High School Diploma/GED required, Bachelors or CASAC/CASAC-t a plus
* Case management experience a plus especially working with individuals with a substance use disorder
* Clean and valid drivers license required
* Must be able to establish workload priorities and balance diverse duties
* Must have excellent communication skills, both orally and in writing, with individuals and groups regarding confidential, complex and sensitive issues

**Benefits**:

* Health, Dental and Vision Insurance, and more
* Competitive PTO and employee perks/benefits
* 403 B
* EAP

title: Talent Acquisition Lead, Logistics & CSC
description:
**Company Description**  

At H&M, our purpose is to liberate fashion for the many. We want to shape a new world in Fashion. A world with one ultimate goal: to unleash your self-expression. As an H&M colleague, you’re encouraged to be yourself & more. You’ll take on new responsibilities from day one, learn skills for life, and find new ways to make your big dreams come true.


Our company is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and belonging, and we actively seek colleagues who share our commitment.

 **Job Description**  

As a **Talent Acquisition Lead** in the HR function, your main focus will be setting a clear tactical and operational plan to accomplish short and mid-term hiring goals for all roles within our Warehouses and Customer Service Center. This includes leading close partnering with key business stakeholders and competence representatives, team-roadmap planning, goal setting for Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) on team and individual level, daily recruitment funnel supervision and support for your team, metrics and performance tracking, analysis and reporting, and participation in the broader Global Talent Acquisition community.


This hybrid role reports into our Talent Acquisition Manager and is based out of our New Jersey Support Office.

 **Qualifications**  

Working at H&M means no two days are ever the same, but a typical day will include the following responsibilities\\*

* In this role, you are an experienced manager leading a talent acquisition team, who are responsible for hiring for our Warehouses and Customer Service Center
* As a team leader, you are responsible for setting goals for your team members, ensuring a clear picture of success, distributing workload, supervising and supporting operational delivery of recruitment across all stages of the funnel, coaching and developing team members, and managing all performance and talent management aspects
* Team Management and Recruitment Delivery:
	+ Ensure a clear vision of success and high engagement for the team
	+ Distribute and oversee workload across the team: open requisitions and project-related work
	+ Oversee all aspects of the team's daily recruitment delivery, ensure proper processes and policy compliance, provide training. Support, troubleshooting and scalation as needed
	+ Serve as partner and advisor to senior business leaders in the respective competence(s) and support the team in doing the same for their respective hiring managers
	+ Continuous monitoring and reporting of team performance, KPIs and Metrics, and definition of action plans accordingly
* Staff Responsibility:
	+ Ensure delivery of labor law compliance for your team across all aspects of their employee experience
	+ Facilitate the learning and development goal setting and planning process for your team for professional growth
	+ Coach team based on their job performance and development goals to support their professional growth
	+ Manage all performance, competence, and salary review processes for your team
* Some travel may be required, based on business needs

**Who You Are:**

* 3+ years Talent Acquisition Experience
* Experience leading a team
* Experience recruiting for an hourly workforce
* Skilled in Talent Sourcing and Talent Assessment
* Success in creating and leading a Talent Acquisition Strategy
* Experience in Campus Recruitment

 **Additional Information**  

Why You’ll Love Working at H&M

* We value diverse backgrounds, including but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, and disability
* We pride ourselves on being a values-driven organization, guided by our 7 unique values that have been part of our success story for over 75 years
* You’ll have access to our Colleague Resource Groups (CRGs) to find community and networking opportunities among colleagues
* We are an inclusive company where you’re encouraged to be yourself at work
* You will have access to a large global talent community, where career growth and aspirations have no limits
* We believe in supporting your overall wellbeing and offer comprehensive benefits inclusive of health insurance, wellness and family support programs, company match 401k, paid leave programs, and paid time off, including a community day to serve your local community
* You’ll be able to express your personal style with our employee discount at H&M, & Other Stories, and COS

  

Compensation: salary range is $ 112,811 - $ 126,912 annually\\*\\*

* This job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job and is not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, and responsibilities assigned for this job at the company’s discretion.


\\*\\*H&M, in good faith, has assessed this posted range of compensation as the accurate range for this role and location at the time of this posting. H&M may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range depending on candidate qualifications. This range may be modified in the future.


EEOC Code: OFM

title: HELP DESK TECHNICIAN
description:
Skyline Windows is a fourth generation family owned and operated business. We are best known for designing, manufacturing, and installing custom windows, window wall systems, and terrace doors. All of our products are made to order based on our clients project specifications. From landmarks to new construction, high end residential to high volume commercial, we do it all!

Primary duties include end user technical support, including hardware/software installation, troubleshooting, Phone support, printer support, and AV. This position is on-site and will support on-site and remote users.


**Essential Functions:**  

Provide Technical Assistance for computer hardware, software, servers, Phones. Mobile devices and Printers/Copiers.  

Setup and Install Desktops, Laptops, Printers, Phones, Mobile Devices and peripheral equipment.  

Setup and Support Windows OS and Mobile Devices IOS and Android.  

Perform user account management within Active Directory and Office 365.  

Respond to support requests via email, phone or ticketing system.  

Travel to New Jersey office (Wood-Bridge) when required, flexibility to work nights and/or weekends as needed.  

Be willing to work outside of the standard business hours as necessary  

Clear, courteous and professional verbal and written skills  

Ability to multi-task while prioritizing service tickets accordingly  

Ability to efficiently troubleshoot and seek out resolution to software and hardware issues

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**

Proficient with Microsoft Windows OS and Office Suite.  

Ability to work in help desk environment  

Willingness to learn new systems and skills  

Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.  

Ability to be Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision. High degree of integrity and trust  

Ability to maintain confidentiality of all company and customer information  

Microsoft Strong troubleshooting skills

**Experience & Education:**


Requires formal training in Information Technology from an accredited technical school or college. Certificate, Associates or Bachelors degree.  

Certifications preferred

 **Core Competencies:**


Customer service focused.  

Excellent communication skills.  

Problem Solving/Analysis  

Willing to learn new skills

title: Peer Recovery Coach - Brooklyn Collaborative Legal Engagement Addiction Response F
description:
Peer Recovery Coach


EAC Network, a not-for-profit social service agency that empowers, assists, and cares for over 62,888 people in need through 100 programs across Long Island and NYC, seeks a Peer Recovery Coach to work full time for its Collaborative Legal Engagement and Addiction Response (CLEAR) program. **Candidates with lives experience of recovery highly recommended to apply!**


The Peer Recovery Coach position is a non-exempt position paying $31.85. per hour at 35 hours per week. Available shifts include: 4 PM-12 AM, 12 AM-8 AM, and 8 AM-4 PMwith varied days including weekends. The office is located in Brooklyn, NY and the role reports to the Program Director.


**Comprehensive benefits package includes:**

* Medical
* Dental
* 401K
* Vision
* Very generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & More.

**Primary Purpose of Job:**


The Peer Recovery Coach for the Brooklyn Collaborative Legal Engagement and Addiction Response (CLEAR) program is responsible for providing on-going culturally responsive and appropriate support for participants referred to the program by fostering positive relationships and connecting them to services in the community.

**Principal Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Respond to precincts throughout Brooklyn to talk to prospective participants about the program and its benefits.
* Identify and facilitate emergency resources for participants.
* Encourage participants to visit with the program Case Manager and follow up with referrals to community-based support resources and other ancillary services.
* Meet with clients on an on-going, as needed basis on and off site and be available via email and cell phone for support, advice, and guidance.
* Provide a Naloxone kit and training to participants if needed.
* Participate in team meetings.
* Participate in regularly scheduled on-going trainings and supervision.
* Maintain client charts and notes, update after each interaction with client and have available for inspection by supervision at any time.
* Community outreach and liaising with criminal justice agencies such as court staff, police, parole/probation officers).

**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Required:**

* High School diploma or educational equivalent required.
* Certified Peer Recovery Coach Certification (CRPA) or training preferred.
* OASAS/OMH Peer Specialist Certification or peer specialist training such as Howie the Harp Peer Advocacy and Training Center Peer Specialist Program preferred.
* Must have good communication skills, both oral and written.
* Ability to work cooperatively with multiple agencies.
* Knowledge of target population and borough resources.
* Willing to travel throughout Brooklyn.
* Ability to work nights and weekends.
* Must be proficient in computer applications or other automated systems such as spreadsheets, Microsoft Office applications, calendar, email and/or database software necessary to perform work assignments.
